question: 小舟
sourceMnemonic: A <kanji>small</kanji> <kanji>boat</kanji> is a <vocabulary>boat</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>small craft</vocabulary>. If something is a "big boat" it's better to call it a "ship" I think, which is why this is just a <vocabulary>boat</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: The readings are all ones you've seen before. <ja>小</ja> uses its <ja>こ</ja> reading, so just think of this like a "child boat." This makes sense because it's small. Watch out for the rendaku.
